name: Smertrius

attributes.attribute: includes a syllable, smer-, also found in the name of the goddess Rosmerta and apparently meaning “protection”
shows him as a strong, bearded man with a snake’s tail

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Continental Celtic deity known as Smertrius (Smertrios, Smertrio). The deity's name contains the syllable "smer-", which can be found in the name of the goddess Rosmerta and is believed to mean "protection." Smertrius is a lesser-known god, and only one sculpture related to the deity has been found. The sculpture depicts Smertrius as a robust man sporting a beard and a snake's tail.
